page.title: 15 TEE UP AT DALMILLING!
page.content: Provision of suitable leisure and recreational activities is a necessity in to-day's world of ever increasing numbers of unemployed people and of those with short working hours.Despite its lack of amenities,Dalmilling does have a{golf course,}which,in a manner of speaking,grew with the community. In 1959 a nine hole golf course was developed in a suitable,large area of land,previously used for grazing.After landscaping,by adding attractive features,such as hills and trees to make the piece of ground into a course of interest and challenge,the planners and groundsmen succeeded in forming a fine little golf course, attracting many local golfers.By 1966,the course was extended to a full eighteen hole course.
